cs113.calendar.guiview
Class LabeledTextField

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
                  javax.swing.JTextField
                      cs113.calendar.guiview.LabeledTextField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class LabeledTextField
extends javax.swing.JTextField

Standard JTextField with a prompt super-imposed over the control in lieu of a standard JLabel. The prompt is rendered in the FOREGROUND_PROMPT color, in contrast to user input, which is rendered in the FOREGROUND_EDITED color. Note that getText() will return an empty string (i.e. "") if the prompt is being displayed.

Author:
Michael Koval
See Also:
Serialized Form

LabeledTextField

public LabeledTextField(java.lang.String prompt,

Construct a new text field, complete with a JLabel-replacing prompt.

Parameters:
prompt - label that fills the text field when it has not been modified by the user
length - number of characters to be visible in the text field at once (i.e. its width)

Method Detail

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Gets the current contents of this text field. Returns an empty string (i.e. "") if the prompt is being displayed.

Overrides:
getText in class javax.swing.text.JTextComponent

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String t)
Sets the current contents of this text field, updating the style and state of the text field as needed. Set the text to an empty string (i.e. "") to restore the prompt.

Overrides:
setText in class javax.swing.text.JTextComponent

reset

protected void reset()
Resets this text field to its empty state, awaiting user input.

clear

protected void clear()
Clear this text field, restoring it to its unused state. This includes changing the style of the field and restoring the prompt text.

addChangeListener

public void addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener listener)
Listen for a change in the value in this text field (i.e. returned by getText()). Implicit contract guarantees this will be exactly once for every state changes.

Parameters:
listener - event listener to be notified of a state changes

Parameters:
